noun.description: An outline of something, especially a person's face, as seen from one side.
examples: the man turned and she caught his profile

noun.description: A short article giving a description of a person or organization.
examples: a profile of a Texas tycoon

noun.description: The extent to which a person or organization attracts public notice.
examples: raising the profile of women in industry

noun.description: A graphical or other representation of information relating to particular characteristics of something, recorded in quantified form.
examples: the blood profiles of cancer patients

verb.description: Describe (a person or organization, especially a public figure) in a short article.
examples: he was to profile each candidate

verb.description: Represent in outline from one side.
examples: he was standing motionless, profiled on the far side of the swimming pool

phrases: a photograph of Leon in profile
This auburn light danced and glinted on my companion's drooping gold earrings as we surveyed the cars below, and held his face in profile as if he might only be a photograph.
Underwood Side View shows a stately old typewriter in profile, exposing its logical yet formally ornate internal mechanism.
One can discern a face in profile emerging from the right side of the pool.
In one photograph, she stands in profile holding a large kitchen knife.
origin: Mid 17th century: from obsolete Italian profilo, from the verb profilare, from pro- forth + filare to spin, formerly draw a line (from Latin filare, from filum thread).
